p: There were significant differences between different groups in one-way ANOVA ( p < 0.001). Tukey’s post hoc test showed that in the groups receiving 30, 100 and 300 mg/kg of the extract and the group receiving rutin (10 mg/kg), serum antioxidant capacity was significantly increased, compared to the control group ( p < 0.001). According to the serum antioxidant capacity, there was no significant difference between one of the groups receiving extract (300 mg/kg) and the group receiving rutin ( p > 0.05), but the difference between two of the groups receiving extract (30 and 100 mg/kg) and rutin-receiving group was significant ( p < 0.001). There was also a significant difference between the groups receiving extract (30, 100, and 300 mg/kg) ( p < 0.001) ( Figure 3).
